intro: Seseli sisarum, commonly known as the European seseli, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves and small, yellowish-green flowers that appear in umbels. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky areas. It is native to southern and eastern Europe and parts of western Asia. Seseli sisarum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of environmental conditions.
